publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4027 Des McNulty: Cut the Strings—That the Parliament supports Jubilee Scotland’s Cut the Strings campaign and its call for an end to attaching harmful economic policy conditions to debt relief; notes that, despite it now being UK policy not to attach harmful conditions, such as privatisation, trade liberalisation and cuts in social spending to aid, debt relief is still made subject to World Bank or IMF conditions that undermine democracy and delay delivering resources needed to alleviate poverty, and believes that the United Kingdom should take a lead by delivering debt relief without harmful conditions.

S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Mr Frank McAveety*, Rob Gibson*, Marlyn Glen*, Trish Godman*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Nora Radcliffe*, Susan Deacon*, Mike Pringle*, Bill Butler*, Michael McMahon*, Linda Fabiani*, Maureen Macmillan*, Jackie Baillie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Patrick Harvie*, John Home Robertson*, Bristow Muldoon*, Tommy Sheridan*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Chris Ballance*, Mr John Swinney*, Richard Lochhead*, Eleanor Scott*, Frances Curran*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Sarah Boyack*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*

S2M-4027 Des McNulty: Cut the Strings—That the Parliament supports Jubilee Scotland’s Cut the Strings campaign and its call for an end to attaching harmful economic policy conditions to debt relief; notes that, despite it now being UK policy not to attach harmful conditions, such as privatisation, trade liberalisation and cuts in social spending to aid, debt relief is still made subject to World Bank or IMF conditions that undermine democracy and delay delivering resources needed to alleviate poverty, and believes that the United Kingdom should take a lead by delivering debt relief without harmful conditions. Supported by: Mr Frank McAveety, Rob Gibson, Marlyn Glen, Trish Godman, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Dr Elaine Murray, Nora Radcliffe, Susan Deacon, Mike Pringle, Bill Butler, Michael McMahon, Linda Fabiani, Maureen Macmillan, Jackie Baillie, Margaret Jamieson, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Patrick Harvie, John Home Robertson, Bristow Muldoon, Tommy Sheridan, Karen Gillon, Mr Jim Wallace, Chris Ballance, Mr John Swinney, Richard Lochhead, Eleanor Scott, Frances Curran, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathie Craigie, Sarah Boyack, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Robin Harper*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Christine May*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Kate Maclean*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Mark Ballard*, Cathy Peattie*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4027 Cut the Strings (lodged on 28 February 2006) Helen Eadie*, Marilyn Livingstone*
